publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

bio.p: George Stoll is an operations research analyst with the Center for Army Analysis, Fort Belvoir, Virginia, specializing in logistical support analysis and Army force structure issues.

Mr Stoll received a bachelors’ degree in physics from Vanderbilt University in 1972 and a master’s degree in operations research from George Washington University in 1989. He was an Army ordnance officer from 1972 to 1984, serving with the First Infantry Division (Forward), Eighth Infantry Division, and HQ US Army Europe Deputy Chief of Staff for Logistics. He has been with the Center for Army Analysis since 1984.
